instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not wake up after sleep
threads.message:
Clean board when the lid is closed or mac is manually entered into sleep mode or if it enters sleep the Mac won't wake up, the CPU feels quite hot and if you plug the charger the Mac makes the charging sound but there is no image or USB activity.

Also tested this board on another known good case and same problem.

Already restored T2 and installed clean OS.

Replaced <CHIP>U4802</CHIP> 

Before and after replacing <CHIP>U4802</CHIP> this are the measurements:

<CHIP>U4802</CHIP> and J4802 diode mode readings are correct voltages also seem fine.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not wake up after sleep
threads.message: What are <CHIP>U4802</CHIP> voltages, when the problem appears?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not wake up after sleep
threads.message:
<CHIP>U4802</CHIP> signals - Lid closed.

Pin 1 - 0V
Pin 2 - 1.8V but I can only measure this with lid sensor disconnected
Pin 4 - 0V
Pin 6 - 1.8V

<CHIP>U4802</CHIP> signals - Lid Open.

Pin 1 - 0V
Pin 2 - I can only measure this with lid sensor disconnected
Pin 4 - 1.8V
Pin 6 - 1.8V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not wake up after sleep
threads.message:
"<CHIP>U4802</CHIP> signals - Lid Open.

Pin 1 - 0V"
It must be 1.8V; check if J4802 gets 1.8V at pin 4.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not wake up after sleep
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not wake up after sleep
threads.message:
Then corresponding Hall sensor is bad, or corroded.
It MUST return 1.8V, when lid is open.
